intro: Potamogeton alatofructus, commonly known as the narrow-leaf pondweed, is a submerged aquatic plant native to North America. It has long, slender leaves that are often ribbed and can grow up to 30 centimeters in length. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or yellowish in color. Its rhizomes form dense underwater stands, which can help stabilize sediments in aquatic environments. Potamogeton alatofructus plays a role in providing habitat for various aquatic organisms.
